questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
questions.explanation: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language. It is the standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser.

questions.question: Which of the following elements is used for making any text bold in HTML?
questions.explanation: The `<b>` tag is used to define bold text in an HTML document.

questions.question: Which of the following attributes is used to add link to any element?
questions.explanation: The `href` attribute is used in an anchor tag (`<a>`) to specify the URL of the page the link goes to.

questions.question: How can you make a numbered list in HTML?
questions.explanation: `<ol>` is used for creating an ordered list, where items are numbered.

questions.question: Which tag is used to create a dropdown list in HTML?
questions.explanation: The `<select>` tag is used to create a dropdown list in HTML.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used for displaying the largest heading?
questions.explanation: `<h1>` defines the largest heading in HTML.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the `<div>` tag in HTML?
questions.explanation: The `<div>` tag is used to define a division or a section in an HTML document.

questions.question: Which attribute specifies a unique identifier for an HTML element?
Which of the following HTML elements is used for inserting a line break?
questions.explanation:
`
` is used to insert a single line break.

questions.question: What does the `<canvas>` element in HTML5 do?
options: Creates a container for an image
Used to draw graphics on a web page
Defines a section within a document
questions.explanation: The `<canvas>` element is used to draw graphics on a web page via scripting (usually JavaScript).
